_comment: Created by ianb on 04/11/2014 13:31:14 using v2.2
title: How do breastfeeding trends compare internationally?
analysis_commentary: Here we look at the proportion of infants in the UK reaching their first birthday in the given calendar year who were breastfed, at least partially, when they were 3 months of age. We can see that relative to a selection of other countries, rates in the UK have been increasing but are still the lowest. Sweden has had the highest proportion of breastfed infants (over 80%) but there has been a declining trend.
data_source: European Health for All Database, WHO/Europe
